discussion.content:
Administrative workstation: FSLogixAppsRuleEditorSetup.exe only
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/fslogix/how-to-install-fslogix#install-fslogix-apps-rule-editor-and-java-rule-editor

Session host: FSLogixAppsSetup.exe only
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/fslogix/how-to-install-fslogix#install-fslogix-apps-core-product

according to copilot the answer is correct
o set up an FSLogix Administrator machine, you'll need to install several components. Here's a summary of the key requirements:

FSLogix Apps (Core Product): This is the main application required for managing FSLogix containers.

FSLogix Apps Rule Editor: This tool allows administrators to create and manage rules for FSLogix applications.

Java Rule Editor: This is used for creating and managing Java-based rules

According to Copilot:
For the Administrative Workstation:
- FSLogixAppsRuleEditorSetup.exe only: This is used for creating and managing rules for application masking and profile containers.
For the Session Host:
- FSLogixAppsSetup.exe only: This is required to apply the rules created on the administrative workstation and to manage user profiles and application masking.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have an Azure subscription.

You are planning an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment that will use custom Windows 11 images.

You need to configure the custom images to meet the following requirements:

• Support FSLogix application masking.
• Minimize the components installed in each image.

Which FSLogix components should you install in the administrative workstation image, and which FSLagix components should you install in the session host image? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

You have an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment.

You plan to create the host pools shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You plan to provide external users with access to the session hosts.

You need to ensure that connections to Azure Virtual Desktop are licensed by using per-user access pricing.

To which host pools will per-user access pricing apply?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Per user licensing isn't supported on server os
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/licensing

Correct Answer.
Per-user access pricing only applies to Windows 10 and Windows 11 Enterprise multi-session environments. Thus, it will apply to Pool1 and Pool2 only.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/licensing#eligible-licenses-to-use-azure-virtual-desktop

Selected Answer: B
Most references seem to state remote app being the specific type of app is more frequently published with the file path , thus leaning towards B on this one.

Selected Answer: D
The application must be available ONLY during a user session. That means that the application is NOT installed on the session host but streamed to the user session. Answer is D app attach

Selected Answer: D
D. app attach

Explanation:

"For RemoteApp application groups, you publish applications to stream remotely that are installed locally on session hosts or delivered dynamically using app attach and MSIX app attach and presented to users as individual applications in one of the supported Remote Desktop clients."

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/publish-applications-stream-remoteapp

Selected Answer: D
According to Copilot and ChatGPT, the correct answer is:

D. app attach.

"App attach allows you to dynamically deliver applications to users during their session without installing them directly on the session host. This makes the application available only during the user session, meeting your requirement."

Selected Answer: B
To add a new application for a RemoteApp application group in Azure Virtual Desktop and ensure it is available only during a user session, you should use the file path as the application source. These options allow you to specify applications that are installed locally on the session hosts and make them available to users during their sessions.

I also vote for B.
Using a file path as the application source for a RemoteApp application group to make the application available only during a user session. This approach is straightforward and minimizes setup complexity.

App attach is ideal for virtualizing applications but isn't directly used to publish applications in a RemoteApp application group.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/publish-applications-stream-remoteapp?tabs=portal#add-applications-to-a-remoteapp-application-group

comments.content:
Co-Pilot told me C! Hmmm, careful! But I think it is B as well.

So, the correct answer is C. start menu.

discussion.content:
According to Copilot:
You should use B. file path as the application source. This approach ensures the application is available only during the user's session by specifying the exact executable path for the RemoteApp.

questions.question_text:
You have an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment.

You need to add a new application for a RemoteApp application group. The application must be available only during a user session.

What should you use as an application source?

You have an Azure subscription that contains an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment. The deployment contains a host pool named Pool.

Users access the deployment by using the Windows client for Azure Virtual Desktop.

You need to ensure that the users must reauthenticate every eight hours. The solution must minimize administrative effort.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
You should create a Conditional Access policy in the Microsoft Entra admin center. This policy allows you to set the sign-in frequency, ensuring users are prompted to reauthenticate at the specified interval.

So, the correct answer is:

A. From the Microsoft Entra admin center, create a Conditional Access policy

Correct Answer
Creating a Conditional Access policy with a sign-in frequency setting is the best solution to ensure users reauthenticate every eight hours. This approach is both effective and minimizes administrative effort.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/conditional-access/overview

choices.C: Define Pool1 as a validation environment.
choices.D: For each session host, configure just-in-time (JIT) VM access.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Entra admin center, configure the User settings.
choices.A: From the Microsoft Entra admin center, create a Conditional Access policy.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To ensure that administrators can connect remotely to the session hosts in your Azure Virtual Desktop deployment, where all session hosts have private IP addresses, you should use Azure Bastion Standard. Azure Bastion provides secure and seamless RDP and SSH connectivity to your virtual machines directly in the Azure portal over SSL, without exposing the VMs to the public internet.

So, the correct answer is:

C. Azure Bastion Standard

questions.question_text:
You have an Azure Virtual Desktop host pool named Pool1. All the session hosts in Pool1 are assigned private IP addresses only.

You need to ensure that administrators can connect remotely to the session hosts. The solution must ensure that the administrators can connect to the session hosts by using Azure Command-Line Interface (CLI) and the Remote Desktop client for Windows.

What should you include in the solution?
